New Records: Gerrit Cole pitched a playoff gem, holding the Kansas City Royals to just one run over seven innings, a new milestone for the Yankees in the postseason
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge made a crucial catch to secure the final out, helping the Yankees clinch the series
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees set the tone early, scoring runs against Michael Wacha and showing dominance from the start
Post-Match Reflections: The New York Yankees advanced to the ALCS for the 19th time in franchise history, marking a significant milestone
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals' offense struggled, managing just five runs over the final three games of the series
Others: The game saw tension boil over with a near-fracas between players, adding drama to the match
